Space-filling designs are used in computer experiments to explore the input space efficiently.
Here is a simple example using Latin Hypercube Sampling in R:


```{r}
# Load library
library(lhs)

# Create a 2D Latin Hypercube Design with 10 points
set.seed(123)
design <- randomLHS(10, 2)

#Scale to [0,1]
design_scaled <- design

# Plot design
plot(design_scaled, main="2D Latin Hypercube Design",
xlab="X1", ylab="X2", pch=19, col="red")
grid()
```
